div.sent: Bangladesh is a densely populated country of the world.
Its area is about 1,47,570 sq.km.
The present population of Bangladesh is 14 crore 60 lac and in every square km about 964 people live.
The population of this country is increasing day by day.
Ten years ago in 2001, the population was 12 crore 93 lac and 839 people lived in every sq.km.
In 1971, Bangladesh achieved independence.
According to the census in 1974 the population was only 7.64 crore.
In 2001 its population became 12.93 crore- it means, within 27 years the population has increased by 5.28 crore.
According to the primary report of census in 2001, the rate of increase is 1.48%.
This rate is comparatively less than the earlier years.
In 2007, the total population of Bangladesh was 14 crore 6 lac.
The growth rate of population is 1.41%.
Our population is increasing rapidly.
In 1961, the population was 5.52 crore and in 1991, it increased to 11.15 crore.
That means within 30 years, the population being increased gradually has become double.
But in the past, the population did not increase so rapidly.
In 1860, only 2 crore people lived in the land of Bangladesh.
In 1941, it became 4.2 crore.
So, in 80 years the population became double.
Even before, it took 200 years for the population to become double.
The main cause of the increase-decrease of population is birth and death.
In any country if more children are born than people died in a year, then the population increases.
Again if the number of death is more than that of new born children, population of a country decreases.
If the number of birth and death remains same, then the population remains constant.
From this, we can realize that the number of population differs due to birth and death rate.
The growth rate of population is calculated by crude birth-rate and crude death-rate.
Similarly, every year in any region or country the number of dead people in every 1000 people is the crude death- rate of that country.
When crude birthrate becomes more than crude death-rate, population increases.
According to a calculation, every year 25 lac children are born and 6 lac people of all ages die in Bangladesh.
As a result, 19 lac people increase per year.
So the main cause of increase of population is high birth rate and low death rate.
The main cause of population growth is the decrease of death-rate.
In the past, worldwide especially in the developing countries death-rate of children was high.
Diseases like measles, polio, tuberculosis, whooping cough, tetanus, diphtheria, etc. caused the death of many children.
But now many children are being saved from premature death because of the invention and use of preventive vaccination of those fatal diseases.
Again because of the use of oral saline , many children are saved from premature death.
Due to the progress of medical science, death-rate of children has decreased much.
Again because of the initiation of maternity welfare programmes, the death-rate of pregnant mother has also decreased.
Many contagious diseases like cholera, malaria, pox, etc used to spread as epidemic.
Thousands of people died of those diseases in the past.
Because of the invention of antidotes of those diseases, death-rate has decreased noticeably.
Besides, Bangladesh like other countries of the world has also progressed in medical science.
Therefore, average life expectancy of people has increased.
In 2001, average life expectancy of our country has become 60.8 years.
Increase of life span has an impact on increase of population.
With the expansion of education, health-education has also spread.
People have achieved an idea about nutritious value of foods.
Now they know the benefits of taking balanced diet.
They have also learnt about the uses of boiled water and arsenic- free water of tubewell as well as the uses of pure drinking water.
People are trying to stay in a healthy, neat and clean and pollution-free environment.
As a result people are getting disease-free long life.
In this way death rate is decreasing gradually.
But no mentionable change is occurring in birth-rate.
Consequently, population is increasing rapidly.
Birth-rate increases due to early marriages, too.
Another cause of population growth is migration of settlement.
Transfer of the people between two countries is called migration.
Migration is of two types emigration and immigration.
Migration of people from outside to a country is called immigration.
Due to immigration, population of a country increases.
Migration of people from a country to another country is called emigration.
Due to this, population of a country decreases.
If immigration is more than emigration, then population of a country increases.
Many a time people of one region go to another region of a country and live there permanently.
It is called internal migration.
In this condition, population of first region decreases and population of second region increases.
In this way, population of different regions differs due to internal migration.
For example, suppose you and your family members were the inhabitants of Comilla.
But at present all of you are living permanently in Dhaka.
As a result, population of Comilla has decreased and population of Dhaka has increased.
But due to internal migration total population of a country doesn't change.
Population of a country increases only when people come from outside to that country.
The families face insolvency if the income of the family remains constant and number of family members increases.
The per capita income of the members of a definite income family decreases due to the increase of members in that family.
The living standard of a low income family decreases due to the increase of members in that family.
Many children are deprived of their rights proper education for the rapid growth of members in a family.
Because it is not possible for the government or society to increase the privileges of schools at par with the rapid growth of population.
It is not possible for a fixed income family to buy nutritious foods due to the increase of children.
Everyone then becomes weak for the lack of nutritious food.
Secondly , different types of production-based work should be created for women.
If the women participate in those works, naturally population will decrease.
Thirdly , education makes people socially aware and attracts them towards the high standard of living.
For this, primary education has been made compulsory for all.
This programme should be made more effective.
Fourthly , parents should be always conscious about education and health of the children.
To create this consciousness, a social programme should be introduced.
This programme should include mass education, adult education, basic education about healthcare and importance of family planning, etc.
Fifthly , consciousness about the importance of nuclear family should be increased among the common people.
We should inform the mass people of the privileges of nuclear family such as nutritious and sufficient food, proper education, medical services, etc.
Sixthly , population can be the wealth of a nation if the population can be turned into efficient manpower.
Thousands of skilled and unskilled workers of our country are working abroad.
Besides, many people of different professions of our country work in other countries.
The huge amount of money sent by them to our country has contributed significantly to earn foreign exchange.
Moreover, a large part of our human resource is contributing to our economy by creating different ways of self-employment.
So, the huge population of our country is contributing as manpower indirectly.
But we should keep in mind that if the population increases more in proportion than our cultivable land, many problems may be created.
Considering all these we should give utmost priority to addressing this problem and try to control population growth in our country.
